page.title: 13Education: Pateley
page.content: This year the primary school in Pateley had 155 children, aged 4 to 11 years. There are five full-time teachers, one headmaster, a part-time teacher and a secretary.There are six classrooms and a large hall. The school has two play- grounds. One is for infants and one for the older children. The children have lunch across the road in the Memorial Hall. Pateley also has a secondary school, which was built five years ago. This year it had 327 pupils, aged 11 to 16 years. There are twenty classrooms and 23 teachers, many of whom teach more than one subject. There is a cafeteria system for lunches, which are prepared in school, or pupils bring a packed lunch. Everyone wears school uniform, which is grey trousers or skirt; grey, white or blue shirt; maroon or grey jumper and a maroon and white tie.
